headline: Forget the Santa Claus Rally -- Artificial Intelligence Stocks Like Broadcom, Amazon, and Rivian Dragged the Stock Market Down Today
summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) and tech stocks dragged the Nasdaq Composite (NASDAQINDEX: ^IXIC) down as much as 2.4% at one point today.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJINDICES: ^DJI) lost as much as 500 points in a holiday-shortened week usually powered by a Santa Claus rally that has failed to materialize thus far.  Shares of artificial intelligence chipmaker Broadcom (NASDAQ: AVGO) and e-commerce giant Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) traded close to 2% lower as of 2:26 p.m. ET today.

headline: Winners of the tech sector in 2024
summary: It was the year of artificial intelligence (AI) in the tech sector. Yahoo Finance's Akiko Fujita appears on Catalysts to discuss companies that saw big rewards for their technology investments. Nvidia (NVDA) led tech industry stocks in 2024 with a near 174% jump year to date, ignited by strong demand for Blackwell, the company's advanced graphics processing unit. Broadcom (AVGO) closely followed Nvidia, surpassing the $1 trillion market cap for the first time thanks to AI chips. Oracle (ORCL) made a comeback this year, jumping nearly 60%, due to its cloud infrastructure technology and new partnerships with OpenAI and Meta (META). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here. This post was written by Josh Lynch

headline: Broadcom Stock Drops as Chip Stocks Slide. Is the AI Trade Ending?
summary: Semiconductor stocks generally move together in tandem with the cyclical nature of the business.  There were five stocks driving semiconductor performance in 2024: Nvidia,  Broadcom Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Marvell  and Arm.  “Investors are reconsidering their projections for semi companies as AI technology starts to mature and investors start to understand the limitations of the technology,” D.A. Davidson analyst Gil Luria told Barron’s. “If the frontier LLMs are hitting their limits and smaller models are getting better, the likelihood of the great data center buildout to continue beyond 2025 looks less likely.”

headline: Wall Street Bulls Look Optimistic About Broadcom Inc. (AVGO): Should You Buy?
